work.name: Toronto-Dominion Bank
highlights: Managed over 200 Java and NodeJS microservices on RHEL systems across OpenStack and AWS Cloud by automating regular server maintenance tasks and troubleshooting complex issues when they arise
Assisted in maintaining infrastructure and networks to ensure high stability and application uptime of more than 95% by proactive monitoring and prompt resolution of critical incidents
Worked with multiple cross-functional teams to deploy and promote applications from development to pre-production with CI/CD using Bitbucket, Jenkins and automation tools (Salt, Ansible)
Delivered technical support to developers and QA testers by promptly troubleshooting issues and maintaining up-to-date documentation

work.name: FDM Group
highlights: Participated in 13 weeks of technical training to develop multiple applications with Java and Spring framework, including a Forex trading platform and an interactive social media site
Structured the programme, syllabus, and teaching materials for various leadership camps as Programme Executive
Secured funding by liaising with various sponsors for the St John Walkathon Fundraiser

courses: Student Exchange Programme, University of Bristol, Jan 2020 - Jun 2020
Thesis on Detection and Analysis of High Redshift Galaxy Clusters

interests.name: Creating and contributing to open source projects

projects.name: Flask REST API for Calibre
highlights: Built a REST API with Python and Flask. The application is a wrapper around the Calibre executable that exposes a REST API for a Calibre library, providing a language-agnostic way to interact with the library. It contains extensive unit and integration test coverage with pytest and is containerized as a Docker image with Calibre and Nginx

projects.name: Comics Search Engine Web App
highlights: Developed a search engine for xkcd comics with Go and Svelte. The application automatically downloads and indexes all data into Redis, and utilizes RediSearch and RedisJSON to support full text search and an extensive query syntax

projects.name: Personal Homelab
highlights: Engineered a personal homelab with Hashicorp Nomad, Consul and Vault running on Proxmox VMs. The project utilizes Terraform and Packer for Infrastructure as Code and Ansible for automation to provision and manage the cluster efficiently

projects.name: Static Site with Visitor Counter
highlights: Implemented a simple static site with a dynamic visitor counter using AWS S3, AWS Lambda, DynamoDB and API Gateway. The infrastructure is managed with Terraform and changes are deployed with CI/CD using Github Actions
